data.title: Shore Heart Group
data.text:
James Orlando, MD FACC FSCAI

Interventional Cardiologist

Dr. Orlando attended the Ross University School of Medicine before his residency at UMDNJ followed by his fellowship in cardiology at UMDNJ Medical School. He completed his fellowship in interventional cardiology at North Shore University and Long Island Jewish Health System. Dr. Orlando also enjoys his time with his family as well as playing baseball, football, and scuba diving.

Board Certifications:

American Board of Internal Medicine

American Board of Internal Medicine, Cardiovascular Disease

American Board of Internal Medicine, Interventional Cardiology

Arjun Swamy, PA-C

AJ completed his BA in Psychology from Rutgers University. He also obtained his MS in Physician Assistant Studies from Monmouth University, Long Branch, NJ. AJ works closely with our Physicians at Jersey Shore University Medical Center, Ocean Medical Center, and other area hospitals. In his spare time he enjoys hiking, playing guitar, and performing improv comedy.

Ihab Girgis, MD, FACC, FACP, FHRS

Director of Electrophysiology and Pacing, Shore Heart Group

Director of Electrophysiology, JSUMC

Dr. Girgis obtained his medical degree from the State University of New York at Stony Brook. He received his postgraduate training at Staten Island University Hospital 1990-1993, fellowship in cardiovascular medicine as well as fellowship in cardiovascular electrophysiology from the University of Miami, Jackson Memorial Medical Center 1993-1997. He specializes in Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome, supra ventricular tachycardia, AV node reentry tachycardia, AV node ablation, biventricular pacemaker, and defibrillators. Dr. Girgis is also an avid soccer player and enjoys time with his wife and young twins.

Board Certifications:

American Board of Internal Medicine

American Board of Internal Medicine, Clinical Cardiac Electrophysiology

American Board of Internal Medicine, Cardiovascular Disease

Level III Echocardiography Certification

Hospital Affiliations:

Jersey Shore University Medical Center, Community Medical Center,

Leonard Sandler, MD FACC

Director of Echocardiography, Shore Heart Group

After attending MCP Hahnemann University School of Medicine, Dr. Sandler trained in internal medicine at Washington Hospital Center and later his cardiovascular training at North Shore University and Long Island Jewish Hospital. His specialties include congestive heart failure, echocardiography, nuclear stress imaging, and stress echocardiography. Dr. Sandler enjoys time with his family in his spare time as well as baseball, football, and playing the guitar.

Board Certifications:

American Board of Internal Medicine

American Board of Internal Medicine, Cardiovascular Disease

National Board of Echocardiography

Certification Board of Nuclear Cardiology

Tony Chu, MD FACC, FSCAI

Interventional Cardiologist

Dr. Chu attended the Taipei Medical College before heading stateside to complete his residency at JSUMC followed by his fellowship in cardiology at St. Vincentâ€™s Medical Center of Richmond and New York Medical College. His fellowship in interventional cardiology was completed at the University of Rochester, Strong Memorial Hospital, and Rochester General Hospital. Dr. Chu specializes in interventional cardiology, coronary angioplasty, valvular heart disease, angina pectoritis, and preventative cardiology. In his spare time, he enjoys table tennis, scuba diving, and skiing.

Board Certifications:

American Board of Internal Medicine

American Board of Internal Medicine, Cardiovascular Disease

American Board if Internal Medicine, Interventional Cardiology

Michael Aaron, DO FACC, FASNC

Director of Nuclear Cardiology, Shore Heart Group

Dr. Aaron obtained his medical degree from the New York College of Osteopathic Medicine. He then continued his training at Coney Island Hospital, along with his fellowship in cardiovascular disease, invasive cardiology, transesophageal echocardiology, and nuclear cardiology. He specializes in ischemic heart disease, valvular heart disease, angina pectoritis and preventative cardiology. Dr. Aaron loves to cook, travel, and spend time with his family

Board Certifications:

American Board of Internal Medicine

American Board of Internal Medicine, Cardiovascular Disease

Fellow of the American Society of Nuclear Cardiology

Diplomate, Certification Council of Nuclear Cardiology
